metadata.title: CVE-2022-43634 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onaffected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required toexploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within thedsi_writeinit function. The issue results from the lack of propervalidation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to afixed-length heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerabilityto execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-17646.

criterions.comment: netatalk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
